title: Whats your desktop?
content: I’m looking for decent desktop pics…any ideas?
author: stephen_k

I’ve been alternating between these two images for the past year:

Zara, thanks for sharing the mandolux site, there’s some great stuff there formatted for a wide variety of resolutions and monitor set-ups. I grabbed the “wheatg” left image for my 1400x1050 notebook; wonderful rich greens. Beautiful stuff. Now if only I could figure out how to set 2 different images on my 2 monitors (run off my notebook).

they’re using my font but I like my roses pics better than those…  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/93279914@N00/17197382/in/set-437692/](http://web.archive.org/web/20061123004623/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/93279914@N00/17197382/in/set-437692/)
I use a neutral gray desktop. I do a lot of Photoshop work and don’t need any distractions.

I am addicted to Codetek’s Virtual Desktop, and have twelve desktops in a 3x4 arrangement on my laptop monitor, all showing different crops of Vermeer’s girl with a pearl earring, like this:  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gerryleonidas/45440581/](http://web.archive.org/web/20061123004623/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/gerryleonidas/45440581/)

and a constant thirteenth desktop on the external monitor, with a screen shot from the opening credits of Bullitt:  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gerryleonidas/45440958/](http://web.archive.org/web/20061123004623/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/gerryleonidas/45440958/)

I have a folder that I put all the interesting type stuff I find here and on the ‘internets’ and have my desktop pic rotate with a fade about once a minute, constant type-stimuli, burning in my brain!!! AGGGG!

CT VDT is good. I’ve got the demo, thinking about gettin the full version.

I’m with Mr. Weaver - neutral gray all the way. The less icons the better…  
peace

There are cool desktop pictures in the Stuff/Wallpapers section of the 2Rebels foundry website : [http://www.2rebels.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20061123004623/http:/www.2rebels.com/)

I’ve been using these for the past 2 years. Denis Dulude makes cool stuff.

I find myself going [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20061123004623/http:/www.imageafter.com/) to refresh my random daily cycle of images. At times, I go for an all mechanical theme, other times, a blured abstract thing. The last time, insect specimens. Depends on the time of year I guess – or something.

[Imageafter](http://web.archive.org/web/20061123004623/http:/www.imageafter.com/)

I too like to change my images often. For a long time though (and still every once in a while) I had different versions of the tiny Typophile logo background. The fading image rotation feature in OSX is so cool that I took and made subtle changes in the background color so that ever minute or so the hue would change, but the logo stayed there.

There are 43 variations there, I would be willing to upload them somewhere, if anyone was interested. It wasn’t my original design, so I guess that is up to the Typophile guys or whoever made that background first. Let me know though if I am not upsetting anyone.

[Here are what the colors look like though…](http://web.archive.org/web/20061123004623/http:/homepage.mac.com/r.keller/.Pictures/Photo%20Album%20Pictures/2005-09-22%2023.01.53%20-0700/Image-66917B372BF711DA.jpg)
